climbs.name: Shamblers
climbs.fa: Erica Kim, Braden Batsford & John Clothier,  Sept 2019

content.description:
Short route up the arete favoring smaller holds on the left face.

 Most of the holds are quite dirty from rain runoff.
content.protection: TR Anchor off the tree with three trunks at the top of the route.
content.location:
Top of the route: N39ยบ 59.1249 W075ยบ 12.1221

 Approach as per the directions on "Thinking About You" About 100ft SW of "Roadkill". A worn trail leads to the triple trunk tree at the top of the route. Rap off the tree/anchor or follow the loose trail to the base.

 Route is directly above a small shack next to the road.ย

content.description: Route is a good up to the roof (beware of choss on the ledge below the roof, ask your belayer to stay clear) which requires some boulder style moves to top.  Route is fun to practice laybacking, downside is the choss under the roof and poor rock quality there.
content.protection: Trad gear for the crack, no protection above the crack until you can place a piece in the second crack dividing the roof
content.location: Obvious start marked by chalk at the bottom of the crack.

content.description: Small top roping area across from the rowing bandstand.    Use the tree above the approach as an anchor and feed the rope around the roof. Good quality rock following an OK crack for about 20ft then choss under the roof where the arete meets the crack.
